item.title: Docker installation
item.description: Installation on Linux Installation on Windows Installation on MacOS Installation on Linux To install it on linux, fireup your terminal and run: Note: You must have atleast sudo powers! And version will differ based on your linux distro. sudo apt update -y sudo apt install docker.io -y sudo systemctl enable --now docker Now, add your non-root user to the docker group: export IAMUSER=`whoami` sudo usermod -aG docker $IAMUSER Let’s test it:

item.title: Creating your first docker container
item.description: Pre-requisites Docker Installation Initiate your project. Create a folder called my-first-docker-project and contents folder: mkdir my-first-docker-project contents Create a file called Dockerfile: touch Dockerfile vim Dockerfile Add the following contents: FROM nginx:latest COPY contents /usr/share/nginx/html Create index.html file inside the contents folder for your static page that will be served by NGINX proxy. Run the command via: vim contents/index.html Then, add the following content: <!DOCTYPE HTML> <head> <title>My First Container</title> </head> <body> <center> <h1>Welcome to my First Container</title> </center> </body> </html> Build your container using the following commands.
